body_html:
One problem with that is, bazel query does not let us query for different paths on the select statements.
We do have a lot of correct LLVM dependencies that are disabled using switch statements, so bazel query will keep returning these.

I guess we can temporarily comment them out and continue with the task, and at the very end reenable these dependencies.
body_text:
One problem with that is, bazel query does not let us query for different paths on the select statements.
We do have a lot of correct LLVM dependencies that are disabled using switch statements, so bazel query will keep returning these.
I guess we can temporarily comment them out and continue with the task, and at the very end reenable these dependencies.
body:
One problem with that is, bazel query does not let us query for different paths on the select statements.
We do have a lot of correct LLVM dependencies that are disabled using switch statements, so bazel query will keep returning these.

I guess we can temporarily comment them out and continue with the task, and at the very end reenable these dependencies.
